steps.step: Pre-heat grill to medium-high.Tear out 8 pieces of tin foil (about 12 inches each) and lay two pieces on top of one another.Next, place all veggies in a medium bowl and dress with soy, vinegar, garlic paste, sugar and oil. Toss well to combine.Meanwhile, place one piece of salmon in the middle of each foil square and top evenly with veggie/soy mixture.Bring the two wide ends of the foil together and fold to seal.Gently fold in the smaller ends of the packet and continue to fold until tightly secured. Leave a bit of room in the packet for steam to form.Grill for 5-7 minutes, turning once.
Garnish with fresh cilantro to serve.

Pre-heat grill to medium-high.Tear out 8 pieces of tin foil (about 12 inches each) and lay two pieces on top of one another.Next, place all veggies in a medium bowl and dress with soy, vinegar, garlic paste, sugar and oil. Toss well to combine.Meanwhile, place one piece of salmon in the middle of each foil square and top evenly with veggie/soy mixture.Bring the two wide ends of the foil together and fold to seal.Gently fold in the smaller ends of the packet and continue to fold until tightly secured. Leave a bit of room in the packet for steam to form.Grill for 5-7 minutes, turning once.
Garnish with fresh cilantro to serve.
Place the shredded cabbage and scallions in a large bowl.
Heat a medium dry skillet over medium-low heat.
Add nuts and let toast, stirring every 20 seconds or so, until the nuts are lightly browning.
Add to cabbage mixture.In a small bowl, whisk together the ingredients for the dressing.
Pour over the cabbage and toss until everything is well combined and cabbage is coated. Taste and add more salt if desired.
Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

results.title: Steamed Cod with Ginger and Scallions

steps.step: In a deep sided saute pan, swirl together the rice vinegar (or stock), soy sauce, and ginger. Slice the cod into 4 fillets of the same size and season both sides of the fish with salt and pepper.

Place the fillets in the pan and place over medium heat. Bring the liquid to a gentle boil, then cover and lower heat to a simmer. Cook for about 8 minutes, periodically spooning the liquid over the fillets.Meanwhile, slice the scallions into three inch pieces crosswise. Take the green portions and thinly slice lengthwise. When the cod has steamed for about 8 minutes, Scatter the scallions over the fillets and cover again. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and opaque.
Serve immediately. I love this over rice noodles (which cook very quickly, 5 minutes or less) or steamed rice.

ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned
ingredients.originalName: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned

ingredients.name: rice vinegar
ingredients.original: 3 tablespoons rice vinegar (alternatively, chicken stock may be substituted)

ingredients.originalName: rice vinegar (alternatively, chicken stock may be substituted)

ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned 1 1/2 pounds cod fillets, skinless 6 scallions

results.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Crispy Baked Tofu with Honey-Sesame Glaze

steps.step: Prep work: Position your oven racks in the lower third and upper third of the oven. Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Bring a large pot of water to boil for the rice. Rinse the rice in a fine mesh colander under running water and set aside.
Drain the tofu and use your palms to gently squeeze out some of the water. Slice the tofu in half lengthwise so you have two one-inch thick slabs.

Transfer the tofu to a plate lined with a lint-free tea towel or paper towels. Fold the towel over one tofu slab, then place the other slab on top (see photo). Top with more towel and place something heavy on top to help the tofu drain.Trim the nubby ends and any discolored leaves off the Brussels sprouts, then cut the sprouts in halves lengthwise. Toss the sprouts with a light, even layer of olive oil. On a large baking sheet, arrange the sprouts in an even layer, flat sides down, and sprinkle with sea salt.
Transfer the drained tofu to a cutting board. Slice three long columns and five rows on each slab.
Whisk together 1 tablespoon olive oil and tamari, then drizzle it over the tofu and toss to coat.

Sprinkle 1 tablespoon arrowroot starch over the tofu, and toss the tofu until the starch is evenly incorporated (no powdery spots remaining). Arrange the tofu in an even layer on a baking sheet (I lined mine with parchment paper for easier cleanup).To cook the rice: Once the water is boiling, add the rice.
Let the rice boil for 30 minutes, then remove from heat and drain the rice.
Transfer the drained rice back to the cooking pot and cover for 5 minutes.

analyzedInstructions.name: Remove lid, add a dash of sea salt and use a fork to fluff the rice. Set aside until you're ready to serve.To bake the sprouts and tofu

steps.step: Transfer the pan of Brussels sprouts to the lower oven rack, and the pan of tofu to the top rack.

Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, tossing the contents of each pan halfway through cooking, until the sprouts and tofu are deeply golden on the edges.To make the glaze: In a small saucepan, whisk together the glaze ingredients (start with 1 teaspoon chili garlic sauce or sriracha and add more to taste). Bring the glaze to a gentle boil over medium heat, stirring often and reducing heat as necessary, until the glaze is reduced by about half (about 10 minutes).

analyzedInstructions.name: Remove from heat.To toast the sesame seeds

steps.step: Pour the sesame seeds into a small pan. Toast for about 4 to 5 minutes over medium-low heat, shaking the pan frequently to prevent burning, until the seeds are turning golden and starting to make popping noises.To assemble: Divide rice onto four plates. Top each plate with sprouts and tofu and drizzle with glaze. Finish each plate with a very generous sprinkling of sesame seeds and a small handful of chopped cilantro.

ingredients.name: brown rice
ingredients.original: 1¼ cup brown rice, preferably short grain
ingredients.originalString: 1¼ cup brown rice, preferably short grain

ingredients.name: chili garlic sauce
ingredients.original: 1 to 3 teaspoons chili garlic sauce or sriracha (depending on how spicy you like it)
ingredients.originalString: 1 to 3 teaspoons chili garlic sauce or sriracha (depending on how spicy you like it)
ingredients.originalName: chili garlic sauce or sriracha (depending on how spicy you like it)
meta: (depending on how spicy you like it)
metaInformation: (depending on how spicy you like it)

ingredients.original: Big handful fresh cilantro leaves, chopped
ingredients.originalString: Big handful fresh cilantro leaves, chopped

ingredients.name: extra firm tofu
ingredients.original: 1 (15 ounce) block of organic extra-firm tofu
ingredients.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) block of organic extra-firm tofu

ingredients.name: low sodium soy sauce
ingredients.original: ¼ cup reduced-sodium tamari or soy sauce

steps.step: Preheat a grill or grill pan to high.
Combine the sesame oil and salt in a small bowl and set aside.
Thinly slice the scallion greens into 3-inch-long julienne. Stir together the soy sauce and rice vinegar in a small bowl.
Add the scallions, toss and set aside.
Lightly oil the grill and rub the grates with one of the onion rounds.

Place the onions on the grill and grill until slightly charred and softened, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Move the onions off to the side to keep warm. Grill the rib-eye slices until browned and cooked to the desired doneness, about 2 minutes per side.
To eat, dip a piece or two of the rib-eye into the seasoned sesame oil and then place in a lettuce leaf along with some grilled onions. Top with some marinated scallions and consume like a taco.

ingredients.name: lettuce
ingredients.original: 1 small head green leaf lettuce, leaves separated
ingredients.originalString: 1 small head green leaf lettuce, leaves separated

ingredients.name: rib-eye steak
ingredients.original: 1 pound thinly sliced rib-eye steak (you can find this at Korean markets)

steps.step: Bring water to a simmer in a skillet over medium heat.

Add broccoli florets; cook, covered, until bright green, 2-3 minutes.Stir in the olive oil, minced garlic, sea salt & freshly cracked pepper, to taste, and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring often, for 2 minutes, or until crisp-tender.
Remove the skillet from heat; stir in vinegar then mix until evenly coated.
Pour into serving bowl.
Serve immediately. Enjoy.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400.Line two baking sheets with foil; set aside.
Place the vegetables in a large mixing bowl and toss with the olive oil, salt, and pepper, to evenly coat.
Spread the vegetables on baking sheets in one layer.

Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally for even cooking.In the meantime, prepare the dressing by whisking together all ingredients in a mixing bowl; mix until thoroughly combined.
Remove vegetables from oven and let cool for 5 minutes.
Drizzle with prepared dressing.
Serve.

Serve.

results.title: Seared Ahi Tuna and Salad of Mixed Greens with Wasabi Vinaigrette

steps.step: Coat your steak with a combination of five-spice powder and grill seasoning or salt and pepper.
Heat a grill pan or griddle over high heat. Spray grill surface or wipe with a thin layer of oil.
Add tuna steak to the hot cooking surface and sear tuna 2 minutes on each side.
Remove tuna from heat.
Combine greens, radishes and cucumber in a bowl. In a smaller bowl, whisk wasabi, vinegar and soy sauce.
Whisk in oil to combine dressing.
Drizzle dressing over your salad and toss to coat evenly. Slice tuna on an angle and arrange on the salad.

ingredients.name: 5 spice powder
ingredients.original: 2 teaspoons five-spice powder, available on spice aisle

ingredients.originalName: five-spice powder, available on spice aisle

ingredients.name: rice vinegar
ingredients.original: 1 tablespoon rice vinegar or rice vinegar
ingredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon rice vinegar or rice vinegar

results.title: Sheet Pan Salmon with Pickled Ginger Butter Sauce

steps.step: Preheat oven to 45
Heat a large rimmed baking sheet for 15 minutes.
Season salmon with salt and pepper.
Place bok choy, cabbage, and mushrooms in a large bowl.
Drizzle with oil and add half of ginger and garlic. Toss to coat; season with salt and pepper.
Scatter vegetables across one side of baking sheet. Arrange salmon on other side. Roast, stirring vegetables occasionally, until salmon is cooked through, 1215 minutes.

Meanwhile, add wine, vinegar, shallots, remaining ginger and garlic and pickled ginger to a saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce by half. Reduce heat to medium-low and slowly whisk in the butter. Strain the sauce and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Divide vegetables among plates; top with salmon and drizzle with the pickled ginger butter sauce.

ingredients.name: dry vermouth
ingredients.original: 1 cup dry vermouth or white wine
ingredients.originalString: 1 cup dry vermouth or white wine

ingredients.name: ginger
ingredients.original: 1 2- inch piece ginger peeled, finely grated (divided)
ingredients.originalString: 1 2- inch piece ginger peeled, finely grated (divided)

ingredients.name: green cabbage
ingredients.original: 2 cups packed finely shredded green cabbage (6 ounces)
ingredients.originalString: 2 cups packed finely shredded green cabbage (6 ounces)
ingredients.originalName: cups packed finely shredded green cabbage

ingredients.original: 4 ounces shiitake mushrooms stemmed, sliced if large
